summary: Build a meme coin website inspired by theuselesscoin.com, rebranded as 'The Pointless Coin'. The site should replicate the look and feel of the original but use custom branding and a user-provided coin image.
architectural_notes: Single-page meme coin website, static or near-static with fun/animated UI elements
Branding: 'The Pointless Coin' replacing all references to 'The Useless Coin'
Coin is on the Solana chain — all chain/wallet references should use SOL, Phantom wallet, and Solana DEXes (e.g. Jupiter, Raydium)

existing_features.title: Create a full-page hero section with a large animated coin logo (using the generated coin image), the headline 'THE POINTLESS COIN', a punchy meme-style tagline (e.g. 'Absolutely no utility. Completely pointless. 100% yours.'), and two CTA buttons: 'Buy Now' and 'Join Community'.
Create a sticky navigation bar with the coin logo, the name 'The Pointless Coin', and anchor links to all page sections (e.g. About, Tokenomics, How to Buy, Roadmap, Community).

Create an 'About' section explaining the coin in a humorous, self-aware meme style — emphasising that The Pointless Coin has no utility, no roadmap promises, and no serious purpose, just like the original theuselesscoin.com framing.

Create a 'Tokenomics' section displaying key stats (total supply, tax, liquidity lock, etc.) in a visually bold card or grid layout with meme-style labelling (e.g. '1 Billion Supply — Because why not').
Create a 'How to Buy' section with numbered steps (e.g. Create a wallet → Get ETH/SOL → Swap for $POINTLESS → Hold and do nothing) including icons or illustrations for each step.

Create a 'Roadmap' section presented as a satirical timeline with milestones that poke fun at typical crypto roadmaps (e.g. Phase 1: Launch. Phase 2: Go up. Phase 3: We figure it out. Phase 4: Moon?).
Create a 'Community' section with links/buttons to social platforms (Twitter/X, Telegram, Discord) styled as large, bold social cards, and a fun call-to-action encouraging users to join.
Create a footer with the coin name, a short disclaimer ('This is a meme coin with no intrinsic value or financial utility'), copyright notice, and social links.

Apply a bold, high-contrast meme-coin visual theme throughout the site: deep black background, vibrant yellow/gold accent color to reflect the coin branding, large chunky display fonts, glowing or neon effects on key elements, and playful micro-animations (e.g. coin spin, button hover glow). The overall aesthetic should feel energetic, irreverent, and viral.
Use the generated coin image (pointless-coin.dim_512x512.png) as the primary coin visual throughout the site — in the hero, the nav logo, the about section, and any other relevant locations.

Add the uploaded tweet screenshot image (showing First Squawk @FirstSquawk tweeting 'CRYPTO IS POINTLESS. NOT EVEN THE WHITE HOUSE CAN FIX THAT. - NY TIMES') as a visible element directly beneath the navigation header, above the hero section or as the first content block below the nav bar. Display it centered and styled to fit the site's dark theme.
Remove the '0% Buy & Sell Tax' card/box entirely from the Tokenomics section. The remaining tokenomics cards should reflow or rebalance their grid layout to fill the space cleanly.

In the About section, rename the subsection heading 'The Birth of Pointlessness' to 'The Birth of Pointless'. Update the copy in that subsection to include the origin story: the coin was inspired by a tweet from First Squawk (@FirstSquawk) quoting the NY Times headline 'CRYPTO IS POINTLESS. NOT EVEN THE WHITE HOUSE CAN FIX THAT.' — this viral moment is presented as the true birth of $POINTLESS. Write the copy in a humorous meme-style tone consistent with the rest of the site.

Remove the entire RoadmapSection component from the page. Delete or empty the RoadmapSection.tsx file and remove its import and usage from App.tsx. Also remove the 'Roadmap' anchor link from the Navigation bar.
Remove the TweetBanner component (the tweet screenshot image placed beneath the navigation header) from the page. Remove its import and usage from App.tsx.

Update the contract address (CA) displayed in the TokenomicsSection to 'D9amokaerETTwVavdrd3nvWcwMAs3dj5HGPwAK47bonk'. Replace any existing placeholder or previous CA value with this exact string wherever a contract address is shown on the site (e.g. the address display block in TokenomicsSection).

Update the HowToBuySection component to replace all Ethereum/ETH references with Solana/SOL equivalents. Change the four steps to: (1) Create a Phantom Wallet — download the Phantom wallet app or browser extension at phantom.app; (2) Get SOL — buy SOL from any major exchange (Coinbase, Binance, Kraken) and send it to your Phantom wallet; (3) Swap on Jupiter — go to jup.ag (Jupiter aggregator) or Raydium, connect your Phantom wallet, paste the $POINTLESS contract address, and swap SOL for $POINTLESS; (4) Hold and Do Nothing — sit back and embrace the pointlessness. Update all icons, labels, and descriptive copy accordingly so no ETH or Ethereum references remain.

Remove the 'Liquidity Locked' card/element entirely from the TokenomicsSection component. The remaining tokenomics cards should reflow or rebalance their grid layout to fill the space cleanly, maintaining visual consistency with the existing bold card style.

In the AboutSection component, within the 'The Birth of Pointless' subsection origin story copy that references the First Squawk tweet, remove any mention of view counts or the word 'views' (e.g. tweet view counts such as '1.2M views' or similar). All other copy in that subsection should remain unchanged.

Update the HowToBuySection component to reduce to three steps: (1) 'Create a Phantom Wallet & Buy SOL' — download the Phantom wallet app or browser extension at phantom.app, then buy SOL directly within the Phantom app; (2) 'Swap SOL for $POINTLESS on Phantom' — open the swap screen in Phantom, paste the $POINTLESS contract address (D9amokaerETTwVavdrd3nvWcwMAs3dj5HGPwAK47bonk) into the search field, and swap your SOL for $POINTLESS; (3) 'Hold and Do Nothing' — sit back and embrace the pointlessness. Remove all references to Jupiter, Raydium, jup.ag, and any separate 'Get SOL from an exchange' step. Update all icons, labels, step numbers, and descriptive copy to reflect the new three-step flow.

Update the CommunitySection component to remove the Discord card and the Telegram card entirely. Replace them with a single X (Twitter) Communities card linking to https://x.com/i/communities/2027059335088521312. The card should follow the same bold social card style as the existing cards. Update any CTA copy or descriptive text accordingly so there are no remaining references to Discord or Telegram in the section.
